page.title: 12Communications:Letters
page.content: {Letter writing} is a method of getting in touch with individual people. A letter is a message written on paper which is then sealed in an envelope and posted in a post box. The letters in the post box are then collected by a postman who takes them to a sorting office. From there they are delivered buy train or lorry to the destination. A postman then delivers them to the final address. Letters are relatively cheap to send, but fairly slow. They are used for less important information, or where it is essential to have a written record. {Telephones} are used for instant verbal communication. It is possible to hold a conversation with anyone in the world by telephone. The transmitter sends signals along wires to a receiver which translates it back into sound. This is instant communication, but more costly.
